items.title: Around the City in 10 Tweets
items.abstract: Our reporter shares selections from his visual, digital diary of New York.

items.title: Urban Sprawl Up Kabul’s Mountainsides, With Splashes of Color
items.abstract: The fast-growing Afghan capital has to regulate unplanned neighborhoods. One idea? Paint illegal settlements in shades of hues like blue, green and pink.

items.title: Amid de Blasio’s Pre-K Push, a Bid to Boost Learning at a Weak Point in the Pipeline
items.abstract: With prekindergarten classes set to grow under Mayor Bill de Blasio’s ambitious plan, the ad hoc in-home day care providers that serve thousands of city children are getting fresh attention.

items.title: The Plans for the World’s Next Largest City Are Incomplete
items.abstract: Delhi is growing far beyond the formal confines of the city, a case study in the complexity of what we call urbanization.

items.title: Book Review Podcast: Perspectives on the Windy City
items.abstract: Rachel Shteir discusses three new books about Chicago.
